website_summaries.verdict: Top choice for gardeners with bad backs.
pros: Simply insert into ground, step on edge and twist
Pull up, then drop in bulbs or seeds
Earns bonus points for cushioned handle
cons: For optimal usage, you should moisten soil first

customer_reviews.title: Useless unless your soil is very easily worked.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much useless; If your soil is heavy, has small stones and roots in it, forget it. This thing will only work if the ground is very soft and root and rock free. I actually cut "V's" into the bottom of it to give it a serrated edge so I could rotate it into the ground and cut through small roots but even then it was very difficult to use, and being made of soft metal, my "V's" would get bent now and again (should have made them less deep)--and I had over 200 ground-cover plugs to plant. A small spade will give you better results.
customer_reviews.author: Blazing Tartan

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Tool. Too Shallow. Cheaply Made. Blunt Cutting Edge. Bad Welds
customer_reviews.text: Not a great tool. Does NOT dig down deep enough... not quite 6"... Also feels a little flimsy. Used it to plant 400 oriental lilies. I now worry they are not deep enough and will not survive the winter... and the process was arduous despite good soil (small roots and leaves are too much for it to handle). The cutting edge is just blunt. Also I was constantly worried it would break at the weld... and I am sure it will in short order. Would NOT purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: A-quatics

customer_reviews.title: Just got it.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a very specialized tool and not meant for everyone. My back is shot from a lifetime of negligence, so anything that can "reach" for me is already a great tool. My season just ended, but I tested the tool and it works just fine. Probably recommended on soil that is soft or has been "worked" before. As to be expected the "digging" portion fills with soil that can get stuck (my soil is heavy on the clay), so the solution is just to have a stick of some variety to "poke" the clump out. Thank you for the awesome tool! I look forward to many seasons with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Soltesz

customer_reviews.title: Not for grass plugs but super for bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fabulously manufactured tool to get zoysia grass plugs. Well, I'm not strong enough to force the cylinder down into the very thick grass. So my dear husband (negating the warranty) carved slits around the bottom. It now 'cuts' thru the grass and makes the plug. Unfortunately the gorgeous powdercoating is now compromised but it works like a champ. I can imagine if you're not dealing with clay soil and woven grass it would work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Honey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Soft dirt? Yes!  Hard dirt? No
customer_reviews.text: It works great if the dirt is somewhat soft. It isn't sharp enough for hard ground tho. I'm giving 4 stars because garden beds shouldn't be hard clay, but the item could stand to be a little sharper. That said, I love the design. I had one area with good dirt and it worked perfectly. I'm a 5' 2", female. I wanted this so I wouldn't have to stoop and true to it's claim, it did the job nicely. I also recieved great service. My first item was damaged in shipment and the seller had another on the way immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jamz

customer_reviews.title: I hope it stands up to planting and not breaking ...
customer_reviews.text: I hope it stands up to planting and not breaking at the handle tube junction. just several spot welds. Enough metal to reweld with a brace added I hope. Will see how it holds up. I have hundreds of bulbs to plant. The tube is shorter than bully tools at the 5 1/2 inch high planting dept. I need to plant gladiolas 8 inch deep will see how it goes. Will probably dig a 3-inch trench and use to for last 5 inches. not sure how dirt will cling to it.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Livingstone

customer_reviews.title: Probably only useful for gardens that have been worked over a time or two or more
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to use this tool, I've determined that it's probably only useful if you have a garden that's both tilled and "worked". The soil has to be loose enough for the cylindrical metal portion to penetrate the ground, but the soil ALSO has to be firm enough to lift out of the ground in a plug (unless you go in and dig for it, but if you're going to do that, why not start the whole process by digging out the plugs instead of investing in this tool?). I had much more success using a garden spade when planting my bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: S. A.

customer_reviews.title: This is not a very sturdy piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very sturdy piece of equipment. After planting bulbs in my yard for only 30 mins, the planter had bent away from the handle. Not a very good quality product. I returned mine for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: grahamgg

customer_reviews.title: BAD ASS
customer_reviews.text: It's simply bad ass. Get this and you can fix anything in your yard. I had some fungus growing in my lawn. I popped it out with this device. I then went to my back yard and popped out some great grass. I took it to the front and boom problem resolved. You can plant and remove with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for planting plugs
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this tool, sturdy and so easy to use- the holes are perfect, I just put in a scoop of potting soil and then the plug. Having 100 plugs to plant turned into one of the easiest things I have done!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Traugott

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but a bit shallow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a bulb planter that I really liked, but which ended up breaking beyond repair. The Yard Butler version is much, much sturdier. The only complaint I have is that the bar limits the depth of the hole, and sometimes I have to dig out an extra inch with a trowel.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kutschke

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: This is an over priced digger. The hand held small bulb planters have a dirt release. This planter does not have a dirt release and you have to knock out the dirt with a heavy object. It is very hard to get moist dirt out of this planter.
customer_reviews.author: M. B.

customer_reviews.title: Plant bulbs without Bending
customer_reviews.text: This is made with heavy metal, coated to prevent rusting. It has a 30-38" handle so one can stand and place weight on the tool to remove dirt plugs large enough to plant bulbs. I used it to transplant flowers in 3-4" pots.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product for not-so-rocky soil
customer_reviews.text: This bulb planter is sturdy and well balanced, and very easy to use. It works well on most soil. Older kids LOVE to use it to help in the garden, too - maybe because it looks like a pogo stick. Our yard is very rocky and I was hoping this would be a good time saver there, but it is not. It gets stuck on any rock bigger than about a dime, and I'm back on my knees, digging with the trowel! This is not the fault of the Yard Butler tool - just wanted to point out that those shoppers looking for a tool for planting in rocky soil should keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon Owl

customer_reviews.title: SO GLAD TO HAVE THIS TOOL TO PLANT OUR ANNUALS!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. We decided that we were not going to plant any more annuals because it was just time consuming and uncomfortable to get down on the ground and dig holes for these once a year flowers. However, there were some annuals that we really loved to have in our garden so I decided to give this tool a try. Standing up to plant would be more comfortable and a quicker way to get this task down. We just got this tool and found planting to be so much easier. It is fun to use too so we look forward to next Spring to work with out "Yard Butler!" Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyhollo

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong!
customer_reviews.text: I plug st augustine grass on my lawn. I did 500 plugs in 2 days. Cause my soil is still with lots of old grass root in it, my feet and whole body weight have to step on the bar for every time with strong dig. I was worried this tool would break with heavy use. But this tool get my job well done and very efficient. This is a very strong and well made tool.
customer_reviews.author: H. Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Job
customer_reviews.text: We are converting from fescue grass to bermuda. We needed this device to make plugs from our bermuda grass to plant in the fescue area for quicker spreading. It worked perfectly. This handy tool would work well for bulbs, also.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rush

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you are working in clay
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if you have clay. Does not work well broke after about 15 grass plugs. The UPS man came to pick mine up today and didn't bring me another one on a return order so I don't know what I'm going to do with all this grass plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with dry soil
customer_reviews.text: Read some of the other 1 star reviews and believe them, I did not and wasted my money. Had tons of bulbs to plant so wanted this to work. Will only work with good loam and clumpy moist soil. I'm in New England and besides the obvious rocks the soil is dry and it just fell straight through. Best way is just to use an old fashion shovel.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the back hole digger
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy digger which is great for very compact soils
customer_reviews.author: JohnC

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: nice tool did the job great, used it to set my 150 tomato plants fast and easy. did wish the cylinder was a little longer
customer_reviews.author: gunner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Much better than using a hand held tube for older people. Great guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: tootie

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. My husband and I planted 250 flowers in less than 2 hours. Works great! Best if soil is damp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product if you have a lot of bulbs to ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product if you have a lot of bulbs to put out and don't like to do so on your knees. Ground needs to be moist but this thing works well, especially after a rain.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Poplin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't release dirt effectively.
customer_reviews.text: There's no way to release the dirt, so it's kind of tiresome to use. Had to use a stick to push the dirt out each time. Perhaps better to get a model that has a lever that releases the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Ilikenature

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the other reviews claim.
customer_reviews.text: I received this plantar today primarily to plant grass plugs. This thing is built like a freight train and works like a charm. It's well constructed. Whether it will hold up is yet to be seen, but I see no reason why it won't.
customer_reviews.author: DFWRandy

customer_reviews.title: It was for a Christmas gift I didn't use it.
customer_reviews.text: It was for a Christmas gift I didn't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Tough and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: After 10+ years my previous tool gave out. I don't remember the brand, but it seemed well made, as you can tell from how many years it lasted. This one looks even sturdier and didn't budge from days and days of planting about 500 spring bulbs in Virginia clay rich soil. I'm very content with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Savagiana

customer_reviews.title: works well so far
customer_reviews.text: Planted 100 bulbs in less than 2 hours today. Time will tell whether it is durable, but so far it worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father and he loves it! Definitely helps him in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Delicia Baker

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool. With 40 square blocks of grass I did my yard. 80ft x 60ft. After 3 weeks grass start to run to the sides.
customer_reviews.author: amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to help dig holes in my very ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help dig holes in my very clay-heavy soil. It kind of worked, but didn't make digging holes for bulbs any less back breaking. Need to wear heavy shoes so you don't break your foot, and be careful that you don't bang your knee against the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Works fine in soft soil, but not in clay or dry hard soil
customer_reviews.text: Works good in soft soil, but doesn't work in clay or dry hard soil.
customer_reviews.author: Bob T.

customer_reviews.title: Digs holes with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Digs holes with ease. Best if used when the ground is a little wet/damp. The Garden Weasel Bulb Planter was actually a bit easier to use for me.
customer_reviews.author: GIS

customer_reviews.title: did a great job planting bulbs this fall
customer_reviews.text: did a great job planting bulbs this fall heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: fafromnormal

customer_reviews.title: Great digger
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well planted 200 bulbs hardly War of the paint off of it
customer_reviews.author: apryle

customer_reviews.title: Works well but broke
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well but broke at about 450 bulbs. I was surprised because it looked pretty robust.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Butt

customer_reviews.title: Almost long enough
customer_reviews.text: I have long legs and short arms so I bent over a bit more than other users but it still works quite well, and at a fraction of the cost of a stainless-steel one. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence R. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bulb planter
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy but shorter pole than I expected. I didn’t look at the dimensions before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: J. Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Super easy way to get those bulbs planted!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bulb digger. For starters, it's a quality-made product. I've had long handled bulb diggers that have broken because the handle was not well attached to the bulb digger part. This product made my back-breaking work of planting several hundred tulip bulbs a breeze. A tip: be sure to water the area well before using any bulb digger. It softens the soil and makes the task much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Emm

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT !!!! I don't have to get down on my knees until it's time to get down to work the soil... Wish I would have had this years ago...
customer_reviews.author: nurse - SC

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Works perfect and saves my back. Sturdy construction
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Was a little hard to get the dirt ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Was a little hard to get the dirt out once you made the hole so I used a little stick and that did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool for transplanting Buffalograss
customer_reviews.text: I used this tool in conjunction with a Yard Butler RP-3 24-inch Roto Planter (soil auger that attaches to a drill) to plug about 10,000 square feet of Buffalograss. Granted, it was a bit time consuming, but given the cost of Buffalograss seed, this excellent tool, in combination with the soil auger saved me more than $1,000. This tool is well built and sturdy. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it for a professional's use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. McClure

customer_reviews.title: I will use it to beautify a very dull landscape.
customer_reviews.text: It looks ok, but the man in charge of the torrington towers did not come through with the bulbs. So I really can't rate it at this time. I will use it for the cemetary in waterbury,ct where all things have been cut down. I will use it to beautify a very dull landscape.
customer_reviews.author: richard corbett

customer_reviews.title: got this for my 78 year old mother. She ...
customer_reviews.text: got this for my 78 year old mother. She used it to plant a few hundred bulbs this years Her grandkids helped, but the tool kept her from bending over all the time. Well made, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: RB in CA

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back and knees.  Built solid
customer_reviews.text: No more bending over!!! Used this to plant 125 bulbs this year and it worked great! Soil must be damp for it to work best. Creates a nice deep hole for the bulbs. Drop in the bulb, cover with dirt and move on. Only extra tool you needed was something to push the dirt plug out of the planter, then cover up the bulb. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: T. Eiel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bulb Planting Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Cuts a prefect size and depth hole and then when you pull it out it retains the soil. I drop the bulb in and add some peat/ humus. I can plant bulbs quickly with whatever spacing I want.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpop Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for more than planting bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year to plant bulbs and loved how it worked. Made well and easy on the back. This spring using it for all my plantings. It is a great tool to dig up the soil ready for a plant again easy on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Jane W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good and sturdy, most ones you buy at the hardware stores bend after the first few uses.
customer_reviews.author: trevor bourne

customer_reviews.title: Tulip bulb planter
customer_reviews.text: Best constructed bulb planter I've found. Usually the ones in stores are tin junk and don't make it thru the season if the ground is at all dry. This is all metal steel construction and my 250 lb frame jumping on it causes no problems at all. Great. Rapid shipping was nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works great
customer_reviews.text: Works for setting a practice target cup for working on golf game when wife is not using ti to plant bulbs. Good quality and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do, not spectacular
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do... accomplished my task with torn skin on both palms... not the fault of the manufacturer... must wear gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Dipa P.

customer_reviews.title: did what it says
customer_reviews.text: i have bad knees and this helps so much in my gardening. it digs the perfect hole for bulds and bedding annuals
customer_reviews.author: James Gray

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I used it starting at 10am. By 11.30 and 200 holes, it was bent and the bottom had detached from the shaft. Wish I had never bought it - very disappointing. Certainly not durable enough, noting that to make sure that I was getting a good purchase in the soil and to minimise friction I had watered the soil for 2 HOURS beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Product is very strong and won't break digging through tough soil.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: It worked perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and used this to transplant tree saplings. It worked perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Graham

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I can put my full weight (175 lbs) on this with no problem. Goes right through some nasty rocky soil.
customer_reviews.author: Gkcmilner

customer_reviews.title: Not for use in zoysia grass.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use with zoysia. It would work well in a bed or in a non stolon spreading grass.
customer_reviews.author: L Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I planted 98 bulbs in just under 2 hours. Amazingly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Solid and durable
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. However, soil gets stuck and you have to manually remove clumps of soil periodically.
customer_reviews.author: L. Penny

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few days ago to plant 100 bulbs. Our ground was hard but it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Dettling

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had it when I put in the first 86 bulbs
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C. Coley

customer_reviews.title: I planted tons of daffodils this fall and can't wait to enjoy them this Spring
customer_reviews.text: I have heavy clay soil and this cuts through it perfectly. I planted tons of daffodils this fall and can't wait to enjoy them this Spring. I am pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It takes quite a bit of the strain off the back and knees.
customer_reviews.author: phillip ward

customer_reviews.title: you will find this to be better than sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: If you plant a lot of bulbs, you will find this to be better than sliced bread. Let your feet do most of the work.
customer_reviews.author: lorenzo11

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, just as advertised so you don't have to bend over. I put 600 bulbs in the ground and used this for the larger ones, saved a lot of time and back strain.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Dacus

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Great well-made tool, much sturdier than what the "big box" stores have. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: PGH

customer_reviews.title: ... trees and the edge of the planter is very dull. I expected it to have a sharper edge ...
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to use if planting under trees and the edge of the planter is very dull. I expected it to have a sharper edge so it would be easier to go into the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Simple to use and substantially cuts the time and energy to plant bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Flower Power

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Sure makes planting bulbs much easier on your knees and back!
customer_reviews.author: ann76550

customer_reviews.title: Just wish it did a better job of removing dirt
customer_reviews.text: Does the basics well. Just wish it did a better job of removing dirt.
customer_reviews.author: DBoga

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Strong and durable. It cuts through the dirt without undue pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for planting bulbs. i like the fact you don't have to kneel down to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Diebler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tool makes planting bulbs easy.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! I planted about 150 bulbs with it this year and it made the chore simple. It is a 4, because it really should be deeper for planting some of the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: kmcmurtr

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money. I should have returned it, but instead it's collecting dust in my garage. I bought this to spare my back because I had over 500 bulbs to plant. I couldn't get it to pick up the dirt like it was supposed to and it wasn't from lack of effort. I was very excited about using it, but it ended up being worthless to me. I used my little hand bulb digger instead, which was exactly what I was trying to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsley

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: this tool rocks!! nice and sturdy, easy to use and fast to plant bulbs. I did over 200 bulbs in 2 days
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Contraption
customer_reviews.text: Makes planting bulbs easy and breezy. I even wore flip flops and was able to maneuver this apparatus into the earth. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Fix-it Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heavy duty product
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't review it until I used it. Much better than the one I had before. No fear of it breaking or coming apart and the height is great for taller gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: Akakroke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and a real time-saver
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool, extremely well-made. Easy to use and a real time-saver!
customer_reviews.author: gardenlady

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bulb planter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. We planted 2000 + lavender starts with this . No problems . Cut through sod also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How did I garden without this?
customer_reviews.text: I zipped through the yard planting over 100 bulbs in no time. I used it also to plant dozens and dozens of small plants, it cut the time into about 1/5th and no aching back. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mastro

customer_reviews.title: Nice Backsaver!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for bulb planting in garden soil...need to sharpen for roots though.
customer_reviews.author: Raydog

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job planting 250 bulbs this fall. Sturdy, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce F.

customer_reviews.title: Yard Butler Garden Planter
customer_reviews.text: The planter seems to be well built compared to most I have seen. In use, it works well with the exception that the dirt must be moist for it not to leave most of it in the hole, which probably is the case with all of them.
customer_reviews.author: danawh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Not sure what else to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Strong Construction - But Not Best Design
customer_reviews.text: For the money, a very well built unit. Very strong construction. Problem is the dirt get stuck when you dig, which sort of destroys the whole purpose. In the end, I can see where you would be better off with a portable drill based unit. Also, if you are older,you may end up with an aching foot after after using the unit to plant a couple of hundred bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Doverspike

customer_reviews.title: yard butler
customer_reviews.text: I love this bulb planter. I had a different type that opened after you pulled it out of the dirt and it always got jammed.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lee

customer_reviews.title: makes blub planting easier says my wife
customer_reviews.text: Will try it in the blub season but looks like it will make the job easier for those many bulbs we get.
customer_reviews.author: ericw

customer_reviews.title: easy, breezy
customer_reviews.text: This made the project of planting bulbs very easy. No bending to the ground or sitting on the ground. The soil core popped right out, and all I had to do was drop in the bulb and cover with the soil in the tool. The cost of this tool is more than offset by the increase in ease and comfort. I am no spring chicken, but I was able to plant a yard full of bulbs with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: atl mom

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well built!
customer_reviews.text: Most bulb planters you find on the market today are cheap junk. This planter is very well built. I have planted over 500 bulbs since I bought this planter with no problems. I can tell this thing will last for years!
customer_reviews.author: mississippiGMC

customer_reviews.title: Greast garden helper
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. This tool makes garden planting SO easy. I think it's one of my best garden tools and makes life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Useless tool. I was hoping it would speed up ...
customer_reviews.text: Useless tool. I was hoping it would speed up the planting pf over 100 bulbs, but it turned out not to be so useful. It is faster just to use small shovel.
customer_reviews.author: tbogacheva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for simple bulb planting
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, worked more easily than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Tool makes quick work out of bulb planting
customer_reviews.text: Last minute bulb planting went well using this tool to plant over 100 daffodil bulbs. It was used in existing flower beds, the holes were made easily. The planter is made so that the soil plug remains in the planter, the hole is larger at the top than the bottom. That worked well for me, as I worked quickly in damp conditions. The planter might make a dreaded chore into one that I will do more often. More bulbs for a more beautiful Spring.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Morris Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Easy as Pie
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use and allowed me to avoid being on my knees for the entire process of planting the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Serating

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy, effective, getting a lot of use out of it! Makes a good size hole, easy to get the dirt out of it, just the right height...what else is there to say!
customer_reviews.author: Ginra

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The edges of the planter are not serrated or grated in any way, so this this piece of junk is impossible to use. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Andy F

customer_reviews.title: Bulb Planter
customer_reviews.text: Far exceeded my expectations! I'm using this to take 'plugs' from sod to repair dog piddle marks in yard. Works Great!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great. May need to modify it for strength, but built better than all others.
customer_reviews.author: David Pino

product_meta.title: Yard Butler Bulb and Garden Planter Tulips Iris Daffodil Spring Flower Long Handled Planting Tool – IBPL-6
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingSave your back and make planting easy with the Long Handled Bulb Planter from Yard Butler. Easy twisting action makes a perfect hole for bulbs and bedding plants. Long handle prevents bending so you can plant while standing. Operation is simple. For best results, moisten soil before planting. Position the planter where plant or bulb is to be placed, step down on side foot bar and twist to cut hole to desired depth, then pull up and tap to remove core. Drop in seeds, bulbs, or plants with the greatest of ease and no bending your back. Yard Butler guarantees all Yard Butler tools for life against any defects in manufacturing or materials.
feature_bullets: EASY TWISTING ACTION Easy twisting action makes a perfect hole for bulbs and bedding plants. Quickly dig a 6 inch deep, 3 inch wide hole.
LONG HANDLE prevents excessive bending so you can plant while standing straight, saving you time, and your back.

PERFECT SIZE HOLES FOR PLANTING ALL KINDS OF BULBS and bedding plants. Tulips, Crocus, Dahlias, Gladiolus, Lilies, or any other spring flower bulbs and most bedding plants are easy to plant at the perfect depth.
DURABLE POWDER COATED STEEL TOOL IS BUILT TO LAST. 37 inches tall, 9 inches wide, weighs 4 lbs.
YARD BUTLER’S NO RISK 30 DAY SATISFACTION GUARANTEE. If it is not perfect for you, return it for a full refund or replacement.
